definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: The wakes of several ships are visible in the surrounding waters.
sentences.chinese: 在周圍的水域可以看到不少出航的船隻。

sentences.english: I must down to the seas again, to the vagrant gypsy life.
sentences.chinese: 我必須再度出航，前往吉普賽式的漂盪。

sentences.english: If you're going out for a week on the river, you're going to take your vittles.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要出航一週，那麼你一定要帶上你的食物。

sentences.english: It's tempting Providence to go in that old boat.
sentences.chinese: 乘那艘舊船出航真是冒險。

sentences.english: A North Korean, with a bouquet of artificial flowers, joins the ceremony celebrating the departure of the cruise ship.
sentences.chinese: 一個朝鮮人拿着一束鮮花參加遊輪的出航意識。

sentences.english: Sam quickly paid for his ticket and boarded the first outward-bound ship he could find.
sentences.chinese: 山姆很快地買了第一班出航的船票並登上了船。

sentences.english: On board are 40 scientists, all armed with high tech equipment.
sentences.chinese: 出航的40位科學家，全部都配帶有高科技的設備。

definition: to return to the point of departure
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
